column2: quoniam bonus
column3: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus. ^ Give praise to the Lord
column5: for his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus. ^ Let Israel now say
column3: that he is good
column4: that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus. ^ Let the house of Aaron now say
column3: that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus. ^ Let them that fear the Lord now say
column3: that his mercy endureth for ever.

column2: et exaudīvit mē in lātitūdinem Dominus. ^ In my trouble I called upon the Lord
column3: and the Lord hearkened me into broadness.

column1: 6 ^ Dominus mihi adjūtor; nōn timēbō quid faciat mihi homō. ^ The Lord is my helper; I will not fear what man can do unto me.

column2: et egō dēspiciam inimīcōs meōs. ^ The Lord is my helper
column3: and I will look over my enemies.

column2: quam confīdere in homine. ^ It is good to confide in the Lord
column3: rather than to have confidence in man.

column2: quam spērāre in prīncipibus. ^ It is good to trust in the Lord
column3: rather than to trust in princes.

column2: et in nōmine Dominī quia ultus sum in eōs. ^ All nations compassed me about
column3: and in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

column2: et in nōmine Dominī quia ultus sum in eōs. ^ Surrounding me they compassed me about
column3: and in the name of the Lord I have been revenged on them.

column2: et exarsērunt sīcut ignis in spīnīs
column3: et in nōmine Dominī quia ultus sum in eōs. ^ They surrounded me like bees
column4: and they burned like fire among thorns
column5: and in the name of the Lord I was revenged on them.

column2: et Dominus suscēpit mē. ^ Being pushed I was overturned that I might fall
column3: but the Lord supported me.

column1: 14 ^ Fortitūdō mea et laus mea Dominus
column2: et factus est mihi in salūtem. ^ The Lord is my strength and my praise
column3: and he is become my salvation.

column1: 15 ^ Vōx exsultātiōnis et salūtis in tabernāculīs jūstōrum. Dextera Dominī fēcit virtūtem. ^ The voice of rejoicing and of salvation is in the tabernacles of the just. The right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength.
16 ^ Dextera Dominī exaltāvit mē; dextera Dominī fēcit virtūtem. ^ The right hand of the Lord hath exalted me; the right hand of the Lord hath wrought strength.

column2: sed vīvam
column3: et narrābō opera Dominī. ^ I shall not die
column5: and shall declare the works of the Lord.

column2: et mortī nōn trādidit mē. ^ The Lord chastising hath chastised me
column3: but he hath not delivered me over to death.

column1: 19 ^ Aperīte mihi portās jūstitiae; ingressus in eās confitēbor Dominō. ^ Open ye to me the gates of justice; having entered into to them I will give praise to the Lord.
20 ^ Haec porta Dominī; jūstī intrābunt in eam. ^ This is the gate of the Lord; the just shall enter into it.

column2: et factus es mihi in salūtem. ^ I will give glory to thee because thou hast heard me
column3: and art become my salvation.

column2: hic factus est in caput angulī. ^ The stone which the builders rejected; this is become the head of the corner.
et est mīrābile in oculīs nostrīs. ^ This is the Lord's doing
column3: and it is wonderful in our eyes.

column1: 24 ^ Haec est diēs quam fēcit Dominus; exsultēmus
column2: et laetēmur in eā. ^ This is the day which the Lord hath made; let us be glad and rejoice therein.
salvum mē fac; ō Domine
column3: bene prōsperāre. ^ O Lord

column1: 26 ^ Benedictus quī venit in nōmine Dominī. Benedīximus vōbīs dē domō Dominī. ^ Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the Lord. We have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.

column2: et illūxit nōbīs. Constituite diem sōlemnem in condensīs
column3: usque ad cornū altāris. ^ The Lord is God
column4: and he hath shone upon us. Appoint a solemn day with shady boughs
column5: even to the horn of the altar.

column2: et confitēbor tibi; Deus meus es tū
column3: et exaltābō tē. Confitēbor tibi quoniam exaudīvistī mē
column4: et factus es mihi in salūtem. ^ Thou art my God
column5: and I will praise thee; thou art my God
column6: and I will exalt thee. I will praise thee because thou hast heard me

column2: quoniam bonus
column3: quoniam in saeculum misericordia ejus. ^ O praise ye the Lord
column5: for his mercy endureth for ever.
